revised_title: The Effects of Swallowing Melted Lead: A Case Study and Experiments
tldr: A man suffers severe burns and internal injuries after swallowing melted lead during a fire at the Eddy-stone Lighthouse. The author, Edward Spry, documents the case and conducts experiments on animals to demonstrate the possibility of survival with such an injury. The case raises questions about the tolerance of the human body to extreme heat and the potential for recovery from such injuries.
